lexUnit.name: stream.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of a mass of people or things) move in a continuous flow.

sentence.text: Then the front door was smashed down and people streamed into the house .

On Monday and Tuesday , however , the government 's forces in the capital disintegrated as soldiers in the garrison ignored orders and streamed from the barracks to fraternize with civilian demonstrators .
The beach was literally covered with neat rows of deck chairs on the white sand , and a continuous flow of swim-suited tourists streamed from the beach to the protected swimming area .
There were no more creatures streaming from the rear of the shuttle .
Even in these latter years , ` Only three old women at church yesterday , " my father would greet me hopefully , as cars streamed past in all directions .
In a bid to protect the Yanomami Indians , Brazilian police and military are evacuating the illegal gold miners who have streamed into the Indian reserve in Roraima state .
By the end of January Myanman refugees were also streaming into Thailand and India .

The exodus of East Germans continued : 18,000 streamed into West Germany before their country took belated action to plug the last hole in its borders by requiring visas for all future trips to Czechoslovakia .
The two of them had slowed almost to a stop , and the other delegates were streaming past them towards the relaxation of the Seraglio .
` Millions of people are streaming through those airports and they are all potential customers . "
They were streaming through the connecting door , muttering discontentedly and clutching their books and papers as they looked hopelessly around for somewhere to sit .
Humans were streaming out of the building .
The numbers swelled later as people streamed to the Neumarkt square after work to hear the Chancellor speaking in front of the church ruins .
Tens of thousands of East Berliners streamed to the West , unhindered for the first time since the Wall was put up 28 years ago .
Rangers streamed forward , and went close several times before the woodwork again came to Tottenham 's rescue , denying Sinton in the 16th minute .
At invisible signals they dropped into trees , then rose again to stream upwards , circle , and resettle .
` With the haughty air of a general in charge of manoeuvres he was watching the taxis streaming past [ there was no petrol rationing until April 1917 ] .
In the late 1970s , people streamed north from the civil war in Uganda .
